xmml:GeologicalTimeScale.gml:description: A set of interrelated components which define a geological time scale for Australia. Values taken from the Geoscience Australia Oracle lookp table NPM.V_WEBGEOTIME
xmml:GeologicalTimeScale.gml:name: Components for a geological time scale for Australia

gml:TimeCoordinateSystem.gml:description: Time coordinate system for geological time - millions of years
gml:TimeCoordinateSystem.gml:name: Geological time system - Ma

gml:TimeInstant.gml:description: Conventional origin used for carbon dating. Equivalent to "present" for other radiometric dating techniques which have much lower precision.

gml:TimeOrdinalReferenceSystem.gml:description: The Geoscience Australia geological time scale
gml:TimeOrdinalReferenceSystem.gml:name: A geological time scale for Australia

xmml:support.xmml:SimpleCitation: Geoscience Australia geological time scale - look-ups http://www.ga.gov.au/oracle

xmml:GeologicalTimeScale.xmml:comment: In this document, except for the Precambrian where the member Eras are described inline, the "member" properties are implemented as pointers to TimeOrdinalEra's described elsewhere. Either method may be used according to taste.

In this document, except for the link to the definition of the C14 scale, and the to the IUGS International Stratigraphic Chart, all references use the "shorthand pointer" form of URI (http://www.w3.org/TR/xptr-framework/#shorthand), which cross-reference nodes in the current document. This is for conveneince only, to allow us to record all the information relating to this time system in one document. Other examples may use references to external resources instead or as well.
